description.narrative: Project aim to work in four areas (1) creating enabling environment to sustainable return of displaced person (2) improve living condition of IDP camps (3) inclusive and responsive service delivery (4) women empowerment.

sector.narrative: Build resilience to shocks and crisis

condition.narrative: UNDP as the Implementing Partner will comply with the policies, procedures and practices of the United Nations Security Management System (UNSMS.)

description.narrative: Indicator 1.1.1: Number of supported townships which meet set criteria to perform participatory planning effectively (functionality index) Indicator 1.1.2: Number of supported townships in which at least five social accountability mechanisms are used. Indicator 1.1.3: Number of supported townships where projects meet minimum benchmarks as per Procurement Guidelines. Indicator 1.1.4: % of parliamentary committee reports on policy inquiries with recommendations that receive government response. Indicator 1.1.5: % of parliamentary committee inquiries that integrate gender and diversity analysis (different degree of compliance - partial vs. full integration into all stages of inquiry process). Indicator 1.1.6: Level to which the Hluttaw manages plenary and committee documents electronically and publishing these documents on their websites Indicator 1.1.7: Number of MPs applying a systematic approach in representing constituents in an inclusive manner Indicator 1.2.1: Number of government officials trained by UNDP on rule of law, GBV and human rights Indicator 1.2.2: % of men and women trained who show an increased understanding of RoL, SGBV, gender equality and women’s rights, and barriers to women’s access to justice Indicator 1.2.3: Number of women, girls, and other vulnerable individuals benefiting from legal information, counselling and/or representation Indicator 1.2.4: Number of actions/initiatives jointly developed by communities and local government actors to address women’s justice issues and women rights Indicator 1.2.5: Number of government / land administration bodies strengthened to deal with housing, land and property cases Indicator 1.3.1: % of community members reporting increased trust between ethnic groups after the introduction of inter-village/village tract activities Indicator 1.3.2: % of targeted stakeholders reporting increasing in awareness on conflict sensitivity and peacebuilding Indicator 1.3.3: % of community-led cohesion projects implement

comment.narrative: Baseline 1.1.1: All supported townships start at Level 1 (April 2019) Baseline 1.1.2: 0 (April 2019) Baseline 1.1.3: 0 (April 2019) Baseline 1.1.4: No policy inquiries completed (April 2019) Baseline 1.1.5: 0 (April 2019) Baseline 1.1.6: 0 (April 2019) Baseline 1.1.7: 0 (April 2019) Baseline 1.2.1: 95 (April 2019) Baseline 1.2.2: N/A (April 2019) Baseline 1.2.3: 200 (April 2019) Baseline 1.2.4: 2 (April 2019) Baseline 1.2.5: 0 (April 2019) Baseline 1.3.1: 0 (April 2019) Baseline 1.3.2: 0 (April 2019) Baseline 1.3.3: 0 (April 2019) Baseline 1.3.4: 0 (April 2019) Baseline 1.4.1: N/A (April 2019) Baseline 1.4.2: N/A (April 2019)

Indicator 1.1.1: Out of 5 supported townships, all 5 supported townships reached level 3 across 4 functions. Indicator 1.1.2: Out of 5 supported townships, 4 social accountability mechanisms were used in all supported townships. Indicator 1.1.3: Out of 5 supported townships, all townships fully complied with set criteria where applicable. Indicator 1.1.4: The ongoing Rakhine State Hluttaw Agriculture, Livestock, Fisheries, Forestry and Irrigation Committee inquiry into The Role of Seed Improvement for Sustainable Agriculture in Rakhine State, is currently benefiting from strong government participation. At its first hearing, in December 2019, the Committee heard evidence from officials of the Departments of Agriculture, Irrigation and Agricultural Statistics and Land Records. They were supported by Ponnagyun Township GAD staff. The Rakhine State Agriculture Minister is fully supportive of the inquiry and has undertaken to make officials available for future hearings. However, COVID-19 has forced the Hluttaw to suspend sittings and activities for the past three months (at least), which has prevented planned hearings with government officials taking place. While the full inquiry cycle has not yet completed – and therefore no report has been presented for Government consideration and response – the Government’s collaboration on the inquiry to date is promising. Indicator 1.1.5: Integration of gender and diversity analysis in the above ongoing inquiry is assessed according to four stages: Consideration in the definition of inquiry ToR; Consideration in stakeholder mapping stage; Consideration in preparing for and conducting hearings and field visits; A report on analysis of evidence integrating gender and diversity analysis. Supported by UNDP, Committee members and staff have integrated gender and diversity analysis in the first three stages. This has been supported in a number of ways, including: Inquiry planning workshop with MPs and staff, including design of terms of reference and inclusive stakeholder mapping and engagement; Consideration of the barriers to participation faced by women, youth and marginalized groups, and development of strategies and mitigation actions to overcome these barriers; Planning and reviewing conduct of hearings in order to assess actual inclusion, and remedial actions to address any shortcomings. As the inquiry moves towards drafting a final report, the Committee and staff will be supported to integrate gender and diversity analysis in the report. It is expected therefore that the inquiry will feature full integration of gender and diversity analysis. Indicator 1.1.6: The Hluttaw is on the verge of reaching Level 1. Indicator 1.1.7: Level 1 is almost achieved, with most constituency profiles for Rakhine State completed.
Indicator 1.2.1: 250 law officers trained on the rule of law and fair trial standards Indicator 1.2.2: 48% of men and women increased understanding on rule of law and access to justice. Indicator 1.2.3: 2,137 women and girl beneficiaries: 2,002 women and girls benefiting from legal information such as trainings and awareness-raising sessions and counselling through consultations and hotline, and 135 women and girls represented in court Indicator 1.2.4: 2 forum discussions on women’s access to justice and addressing challenges around HLP and inheritance rights conducted Indicator 1.2.5: 5 VTAs strengthened through training on land laws
Indicator 1.3.1: Baseline data (March 2019) indicates the following: Only 31% of community members reported collaboration with other communities on any initiatives since 2012 20% of community members do not support cooperation with other communities Indicator 1.3.2: Reported progress, based on the targeted stakeholders’ self-evaluation, is 46% to date Indicator 1.3.3: 99% of LRF members report that LRF meetings are helping improve relations between different communities (March 2019 data) Indicator 1.3.4: 3 lessons-learned cases (March 2020)
Indicator 1.4.1: 11,947 persons (total no. accessing facilities built by UNHCR through QIPs) Indicator 1.4.2: 44% (723 households (approx. 3,615 individuals)) of 1,642 beneficiary households (approx. 8,210 individuals) reported increased household income

[Interim result 31Oct19] Achieved Indicator Target 1.1.1: Out of 5 supported townships, all 5 supported townships reached level 3 across 4 functions. [Interim result 31Oct19] Achieved Indicator Target 1.1.2: Out of 5 supported townships, 4 social accountability mechanisms were used in all supported townships. [Interim result 31Oct19] Achieved Indicator Target 1.1.3: Out of 5 supported townships, all townships fully complied with set criteria where applicable. [Interim result 31Oct19] Achieved Indicator Target 1.1.4: A topic for the pilot committee policy inquiry by the Rakhine State Hluttaw Agriculture Committee was identified in August 2019 by the Speaker and Committee Chair – the role of seed improvement in supporting sustainable agriculture in Rakhine State. [Interim result 31Oct19] Achieved Indicator Target 1.1.5: To be reported after 12 months [March 2020] [Interim result 31Oct19] Achieved Indicator Target 1.1.6: The Hluttaw is on the verge of reaching level 1 [Interim result 31Oct19] Achieved Indicator Target 1.1.7: A pilot group of MPs have participated in a professional development programme on Constituency and Representation, which included a masterclass on case management and introduction of constituency profiles. In 2020, this will be followed up with further masterclasses and the testing of a new Guide to Good Practices on Constituency and Representation with Rakhine MPs. [Interim result 31Oct19] Achieved Indicator Target 1.2.1: Training of government officials is anticipated in Q1 2020. [Interim result 31Oct19] Achieved Indicator Target 1.2.2: 95% shows an increased understanding between pre and post testing with an average of 48% increase [45% to 93%]. [Interim result 31Oct19] Achieved Indicator Target 1.2.3: 2,210 women and girls beneficiaries, with 2,108 women and girls benefitting from legal information through legal consultations and hotline, and 102 women and girls represented in court. [Interim result 31Oct19] Achieved Indicator Target 1.2.4: 2 forum discussions on women’s access to justice and addressing challenges around HLP and inheritance rights is planned for Q4. It will involve the justice sector stakeholders, UN agencies and CSOs, including women organizations. [Interim result 31Oct19] Achieved Indicator Target 1.2.5: Initial workshops held with some VTAs and LMCs, but main activities to strengthen administration bodies are planned for Q4 2019 and Q1 2020. [Interim result 31Oct19] Achieved Indicator Target 1.3.1: With planning and designing activities, including conflict- sensitive location confirmation and selection of partners, which was executed in Q2 and Q3 2019, community-led projects will kick off in Q4 and be measured against the indicators. [Interim result 31Oct19] Achieved Indicator Target 1.3.2: To be reported after 12 months [March 2020] [Interim result 31Oct19] Achieved Indicator Target 1.3.3: To be reported after 12 months [March 2020] [Interim result 31Oct19] Achieved Indicator Target 1.3.4: To be reported after 12 months [March 2020] [Interim result 31Oct19] Achieved Indicator Target 1.4.1: To be reported after 12 months [March 2020] [Interim result 31Oct19] Achieved Indicator Target 1.4.2: A total of 1,317 households have received in-kind support and cash grants for on-farm and off-farm based activities.
